business.headline: Why China's rare earth export curbs are shaking global supply chainsChina's recent restrictions on rare earth exports are causing global industry disruptions, prompting urgent diplomatic and economic responses.

GRSE shares jump 10% today: What's fuelling the rally?GRSE shares surged by up to 10% after sealing a partnership with Norway's Kongsberg for India's first Polar Research Vessel, highlighting a pivotal moment in deep-sea research and defence shipbuilding.

Is Rs 1 crore salary still a big deal? Depends on where you live and who you askAn alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad has raised questions about the real value of a 1 crore annual salary in Mumbai. He pointed out that in areas like Borivali or Thane, a Rs 1 crore salary might still make one stand out, but in South Mumbai's boardrooms, where finance and tech executives frequently earn between Rs 1 crore and Rs 5 crore, this income is seen as average.

Trump doubles metal tariffs to 50% but skips UK. What it means for IndiaUS President Donald Trump plans to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium, affecting global trade dynamics. The UK's exemption contrasts with challenges for India.

Did Coforge shares drop 80% today? Here's all you need to knowInvestors might have initially mistaken this adjustment for a loss. Despite the apparent drop, the stock actually opened higher at Rs 1,720.05 on Wednesday, with a 0.60% increase. It was up 1.4% on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Are you eligible for PM-Kisan yojana? Check 20th instalment and requirementsThe upcoming 20th instalment is anticipated to be disbursed in the first or second week of June 2025. Under this scheme, farmers can receive the annual financial aid of Rs 6,000, distributed in three equal instalments of Rs 2,000 every four months.

Stop sudden tax demands: Raghuram Rajan on fixing India's business environmentRaghuram Rajan says India must fix its business environment, starting with killing off surprise tax shocks that are scaring investors and strangling the country's shot at global supply chain glory.

Explained: How India can benefit from striking trade deal with USIndia's challenge goes beyond just sealing a US trade deal, it's about finding the right balance between opening up for growth and safeguarding its own industries.

Scoda Tubes lists flat at issue price amid strong IPO subscriptionScoda Tubes saw good interest during its initial public offering (IPO) phase, which ran from May 28 to May 30, 2025. The IPO was oversubscribed by 57.37 times, highlighting strong market demand.

Trump's student visa curbs opportunity for India, says Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan has called the US administration's actions "unfortunate," particularly in how they undermine the long-standing academic and economic ties between the US and countries like India.
Sensex opens 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Eternal up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 89.35 points to 80,826.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 29.35 points to 24,606 as of 9:32 am.

India rubbed US the wrong way with arms purchase from Russia: Trump officialSpeaking at an event in Washington, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that President Donald Trump deeply admires India and the two countries are going to have a great relationship together.

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft to become world's most valuable companyThis is not the first time Nvidia has reached the top. The company had earlier taken the number one spot on 24 January this year but was later overtaken.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,723, as of 8:06 am, suggesting a higher opening above Nifty's previous close of 24,542.50. The anticipation of a constructive dialogue between the U.S. and China

Stocks to watch on June 4: HDFC Bank, Wipro, Ola Electric, Nestle, Yes BankExplore the latest stock market movements with major stakes sold in Yes Bank, HDFC Bank's IPO plans, and strategic advancements by companies like Wipro and Ola Electric.

Cartier confirms client data stolen in cyberattackCartier confirmed a cyberattack in which client data was stolen, joining a growing list of major brands hit by breaches, including Victoria's Secret, Marks & Spencer, and The North Face.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanCan India turn its economic momentum into lasting prosperity? As global risks loom and GDP rankings rise, Raghuram Rajan lays out what it will really take to become a developed nation.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan discussed India's economic outlook in uncertain global times. He emphasised the need for 8-9% growth for India to become a developed nation by 2047.
OECD cuts global growth forecast citing trade war risksThe OECD has reduced its global growth forecast to 2.9% for 2025 and 2026, attributing the slowdown to heightened trade tensions.

Credit score made easy: Check it, fix it, boost itYour credit score is mostly shaped by how timely you are with payments, missing even one EMI or credit card due can bring it down.  A score of 750 or above is considered good by most banks and lending companies.

Sensex closes 636 points lower, Nifty below 24,600; Adani Ports down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 636.24 points to close at 80,737.51, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 174.10 points to end at 24,542.

Smallcap stocks are back in action again. Should you ride the wave?Since the market's low in February 2025, the Nifty50 index has risen by 12%. But the real jump has been in the mid and smallcap space. The midcap index has gone up by 20%, and the smallcap index has climbed 22% during the same period.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: What's behind today's stock market decline?The BSE Sensex was trading 740.82 points lower at 80,632.93 at around 1:13 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 187.65 points to 24,528.95. All the other Nifty sectoral indices also fell as volatility rose during the session.

Own property in India? Why you must fix any paperwork issues nowIn fact, for years, the biggest property scam in India has been when someone who isn't the real owner sells a property. The buyer, after paying a huge amount, later finds out they were cheated, and the actual owner was someone else all along.

ITR filing made easy: Here's a simple step-by-step guide to file income tax returnBefore starting your income tax return, ensure you have key documents in hand. These include Form 16 from your employer, Form 26AS, the Annual Information Statement (AIS) and Tax Information Statement (TIS) from the income tax portal, and your bank statements.

India's GDP growth may decline to 6.2% in FY26, says NomuraThe assessment, published in a research note on Monday, comes amid what the brokerage describes as a growing "divergence" between headline indicators like GST collections and other key economic metrics such as automobile sales and bank credit growth.

Prostarm Info Systems shares make strong D-Street debut; list at 19% premiumProstarm Info Systems share price: The stock listed at Rs 125 on the BSE, which was 19.04% higher than its issue price of Rs 105. On the NSE, the stock opened at Rs 120, marking a 14.28% premium over its issue price.
Ola Electric shares tumble over 6% today. Here's whyBy 10:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 50.52, down 5.9%, after reports of a large equity transaction rattled investors.

Yes Bank shares fall 8% after 3 sessions of gain. Here's whyYes Bank's shares fell 7.95% to touch a low of Rs 21.43. This was a huge change from the recent trend, as the stock had risen 8.4% in the previous session and was gaining for three days in a row.

Microsoft cuts over 300 jobs in fresh round of layoffs: ReportThe layoffs come just weeks after the company executed its biggest workforce reduction in recent years, signalling a deeper shift across the industry as artificial intelligence takes center stage.

Adani Ports, Adani Enterprises: Why are Adani Group shares in focus today?As of 9:41 am, both Adani Ports and Adani Enterprises were the top losers on the NSE Nifty50, down 1.5% each. Other companies in the Adani portfolio also saw marginal declines in early trade.

NSE shares surge in unlisted market amid IPO buzz. Here's what analysts sayWith over one lakh retail shareholders, a record for any unlisted Indian company, NSE has become a hotspot in the grey market. But analysts tracking the unlisted space suggest the rally may not be over just yet.
Sensex down 150 points, Nifty below 24,700; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 226.44 points to 81,147.31, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 45.05 points to 24,671.55 as of 9:29 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher to break recent downtrend?As of 8:15 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,845.5, showing a higher start compared to Nifty50's Monday close of 24,716.6.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO listing: Will it make strong market debut? Check GMPThe listing of Prostarm Info Systems comes at a time when recent mainboard IPOs have not performed very well on debut. Bidding was open from May 27 to May 29, 2025, and saw a total subscription of 96.68 times.

Stocks to watch on June 3: ITC, HCLTech, Biocon, Prostarm Info SystemsThe markets had a shaky start to the week with the Sensex falling over 700 points in early trade, but later recovered to end flat.

Trade deal with India in not-too-distant future: US Commerce SecretaryA trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon, as negotiations gain momentum following reciprocal tariff tensions, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing optimism that both sides have found common ground.

Uber delivery chief steps down after 13 Years; Andrew Macdonald named COOAs senior vice president of Uber's delivery unit, Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty oversaw the company's Uber Eats business as well as grocery and other on-demand delivery offerings, and is credited with steering the division through the COVID-19 pandemic.

Adani faces US scrutiny over Iran LPG 'links', denies role, says unaware of probeGautam Adani's firms are under scrutiny from US prosecutors for reportedly importing Iranian LPG into India through Mundra port. A spokesperson denied the company's involvement and said it was not aware of such a probe.

Rs 1 crore in 5 years: Check this guide for 40-year-olds earning Rs 2.5 lakh/monthIf you're earning Rs 2.5 lakh a month, building a corpus of Rs 1 crore in just five years may sound ambitious, but it's certainly achievable with the right planning, discipline, and smart investments.

entertainment.headline: KGF director playfully hits friend in excitement after RCB's IPL win. Watch'KGF' director Prashanth Neel was joyful after Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) lifted the IPL trophy for the first time. He playfully hit his friend in extreme excitement.

Adolescence becomes Netflix's 2nd most-watched English show surpassing Stranger Things 4'Adolescence' has become Netflix's second most-watched English-language series, surpassing 'Stranger Things Season 4' with 141.2 million views in 80 days. Besides, the show 'Wednesday' and non-English hits like 'Squid Game' rank higher in Netflix's all-time viewership.

Actor Nimrit Ahluwalia skipped Diljit Dosanjh's film due to Choti Sarrdaarni shootActor Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia revealed she missed a film with Diljit Dosanjh due to her 'Choti Sarrdaarni' schedule. She later made her Punjabi debut with 'Shaunki Sardar.'.

Janhvi Kapoor's 'champi' session with Khushi was perfect prep before Cannes. WatchBefore actor Janhvi Kapoor's Cannes debut, she enjoyed a relaxing 'champi' from her sister Khushi. Orry posted the video along with other behind-the-scenes glimpses from Cannes.

Preity Zinta's fans heartbroken as PBKS loses IPL: She deserves the trophyPreity Zinta looked upset and emotional after her co-owned team, PBKS, lost the IPL trophy to RCB. Several pictures of the actor's disappointed expressions have gone viral.

Thug Life advance booking: Kamal Haasan's film gears up for solid openingEven with all the controversy around the film, 'Thug Life' is generating significant buzz in advance booking. The Kamal Haasan film is looking at collecting a good number on its opening day.

Stolen review: Karan Tejpal's film steals your attention and never lets it goReleased-Wed Jun 04, 2025Actor Abhishek Banerjee delivers a powerful performance in the tense thriller 'Stolen', directed by newcomer Karan Tejpal. The film explores dark social themes while keeping viewers hooked from start to finish. Read our review.

Department Q review: Matthew Goode shines in gripping slow-burn thrillerReleased-Thu May 29, 2025Dept Q review: Crime thriller 'Dept. Q' adapts Jussi Adler-Olsen's noir novels into a gripping series. The show delves into complex characters and slow-burning mysteries, promising an intense viewing experience.

Chaliye aap bhi: Jaya Bachchan schools paps again as they follow her to carVeteran actor Jaya Bachchan is often seen asking paparazzi to behave themselves. This time too, she sarcastically asked them to back-off as they followed her to her car.

Ordinary but unforgettable: Why Pankaj Tripathi's everyday characters stay with youActor Pankaj Tripathi, renowned for his impeccable acting, stands out from the crowd due to his common-man appeal, which adds a unique layer to his craft. Read to know more about his skills and how his acting has an everlasting impact.

No more Ee Saala Cup Lollipop: Allu Arjun's son's funny video after RCB's IPL winAllu Arjun's son, Allu Ayaan, was extremely emotional after Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) won its first-ever IPL trophy. He poured water on his head, expressed his love for Virat Kohli and said he cannot say 'Ee Saala Cup Namde' any more.

15 years on, Vedam remains Telugu cinema's unmatched masterpieceJune 4 marks 15 years of 'Vedam', a Telugu film that broke conventions with its layered storytelling, symbolic characters, and powerful music. Still fresh and unique, it remains a cinematic milestone that challenges the industry to aspire higher.

Worth the wait: Allu Arjun, Ranveer Singh, others celebrate RCB's maiden IPL winAllu Arjun, Ranveer Singh, Vicky Kaushal, Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna and several other celebrities congratulated Royal Challengers Bengaluru on their maiden IPL title win. This win ended their 18-year wait.

Anushka Sharma's ecstatic celebration after RCB's maiden IPL win is pure joyActor Anushka Sharma couldn't control her excitement after Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) ended up as the champions of IPL 2025. In a viral video, she could be seen jumping in joy.

Love Island USA Season 7: How to watch, stream schedule, and premiere detailsLove Island USA Season 7 premieres June 3 on Peacock with new twists, ten fresh Islanders in Fiji, and real-time audience interaction through the app. Episodes also air on Bravo and Hulu.

Diddy gave bag of cash to bury hotel assault tape, ex-guard tells courtA former hotel guard testified that Sean Combs paid $100,000 to suppress assault footage. The video, now key evidence in a federal case, supports multiple abuse allegations Combs denies.

What are Labubu Dolls? TikTok's viral collectible is selling out fastLabubu dolls, creepy-cute collectibles from Pop Mart, have gone viral on TikTok due to celebrity influence, surprise unboxing, and high resale value — some fetching up to $7,000 online.

Is Taylor Swift pregnant? Internet buzzes over 'baby bump' photoA viral photo of Taylor Swift sparked speculation that she may be pregnant with Travis Kelce's child, though fans are divided and the couple has not publicly addressed the rumors.

Siddharth Nigam on being replaced by Aaman Devgan in Azaad: Waited an entire yearActor Siddharth Nigam recently opened up on being replaced by Ajay Devgn's nephew Aaman Devgan in 'Azaad.' His mother recalled their shocking reaction after finding out Aaman was playing the lead in the period drama.

general news.headline: Journalist's question wrecks Bilawal Bhutto's 'Muslims demonised' in India claimAt a UN press briefing, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari was left red-faced after a journalist rebutted his claim that Indian Muslims were being demonised, citing Muslim officers leading Operation Sindoor briefings.

Chinese scientist, boyfriend arrested for smuggling crop-killing fungus into USTwo Chinese nationals were arrested for smuggling a dangerous crop fungus into the US, posing risks to food security and public health. They face multiple federal charges and possible deportation.

1 million subscribers, Jyoti Malhotra link: Another YouTuber arrested for 'spying'YouTuber Jasbir Singh, who runs the channel 'Jaan Mahal' with over 1.1 million subscribers, has close ties with Jyoti Malhotra — already arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan.

No open bus parade for RCB due to traffic congestion fearsIPL 2025: The open bus parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru after their Indian Premier League win has been called off due to traffic congestion in the city. On Tuesday, RCB won their maiden title after beating Punjab Kings.

Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's top space thrill? He tells IndiaToday.inIndian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla took questions from India Today Science in a briefing to reveal what he is most excited about when he reaches the Space Station.

We are both Islamic nations: Pak's religion card against India flops in MalaysiaTrying to play the religion card, the Pakistani embassy urged Malaysian government officials to cancel all 10 programmes by the Sanjay Jha-led delegation, saying, 'We are an Islamic country, you are an Islamic country... don't listen to the Indian delegation.'

Meme-material to game-changers: How bowling became RCB's IPL crown jewelOnce ridiculed for their toothless attack, Royal Challengers Bengaluru's bowling unit turned the narrative on its head in IPL 2025. Long seen as meme-material in a batting-heavy franchise, the bowlers rose to the occasion when it mattered most—delivering the knockout punch in the final and sealing RCB's maiden title.

Hindu temple hit by terrorists to be on Bangladesh 20-taka notesThe Muhammad Yunus-led interim government is on a drive to move Bangladesh away from the legacy and memory of Mujibur Rahman, its founding father. The image of a Hindu temple targeted by Islamic terrorists is among those replacing Mujib on the new banknotes. Here's more about the Kantajew temple of Dinajpur on whose premises a mosque was also coming up.

Inside Japan's fantasy-fuelled love hotelsJapan's love hotels were initially considered a place that offered couples space for intimacy. Today, it has transitioned beyond exploration of the sexual side, and piques the curiosity of travellers too.

Parliament's Monsoon Session from July 21 to August 12; first after Op SindoorThe Monsoon Session of Parliament will be held from July 21 to August 12, according to the recommendations sent by the Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs to the President, sources told India Today TV.

India rubbed US the wrong way with arms purchase from Russia: Trump officialSpeaking at an event in Washington, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that President Donald Trump deeply admires India and the two countries are going to have a great relationship together.

India-paranoid Pakistan to scrap projects worth PKR 1,000 bnWith only Rs 880 billion (PKR) for development in the upcoming Budget, the Pakistani government has scrapped over 118 projects, report media outlets in the neighbouring country. The announcement comes amid recent reports of the Pakistani government hiking the defence budget by 18%.

What is agro-terrorism, for which US arrested 2 Chinese? India a victim tooTwo Chinese nationals have been charged in the US for smuggling a toxic fungus in an attempt to infect farmland. The incident brings into the spotlight a quieter yet devastating form of terrorism that has taken root in several countries - agro-terrorism.

Bihar twist: Owaisi, dubbed BJP's 'B team' by RJD, Congress, wants to join INDIAOften tagged as the BJP's 'B team' by the RJD and Congress, Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM has expressed interest in joining the Mahagathbandhan ahead of the Bihar assembly elections.

Congress repeats 'Narendra surrender' jab: Had Pak by throat when Trump calledPawan Khera said the Prime Minister 'surrendered' and agreed to a ceasefire with Pakistan after a call from Donald Trump despite the armed forces being in a dominant position.

Tourist's body found in Meghalaya gorge, wife missing. Indore MP calls it murderThe couple went missing on May 23, hours after they checked out of their homestay at Nongriat village, located in Meghalaya's East Khasi Hills district.

Namde to Namdu: Virat's 18-year quest turns Bengaluru's cheat code into IPL gloryFrom a 90s kid in Bihar watching black-and-white TV to becoming a loyal RCB fan in his karmabhoomi Bengaluru, the journey mirrors the city's own underdog spirit and slow but steady rise. In 2025, after 18 years of heartbreak, Virat Kohli and RCB finally lifted the IPL trophy, changing not just a war-cry, but the emotional script of a generation.

What is the fungus pathogen smuggled into US to kill wheat?Classified as a potential agroterrorism weapon, this fungus causes Fusarium head blight (FHB), infecting wheat, barley, maize, and rice during critical growth stages.

Trump doubles metal tariffs to 50% but skips UK. What it means for IndiaUS President Donald Trump plans to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium, affecting global trade dynamics. The UK's exemption contrasts with challenges for India.

Ukraine used 20-year-old Open Source software in its Operation Spider Web against RussiaUkraine reportedly used a nearly 20-year-old open-source ArduPilot software in its  Operation Spider Web to destroy over a third of Russia's long-range bombers.

Delhi bans non-BS6, non-CNG, non-EV commercial vehicles from November 1Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta announced the Air Pollution Mitigation Plan 2025, aiming to curb emissions by allowing only BS6, CNG, or electric commercial vehicles from November 1, alongside green mobility reforms.

Hindu outfit pitches clay goats for eco-friendly Eid, riles Muslim bodyA Hindu organisation, Sanskriti Bachao Manch, has appealed to the Muslim community to sacrifice clay goats instead of the animals on Eid al-Adha or Bakrid.

After Col Sofiya remark, BJP Minister's photo with rape victim's family goes viralAfter crass remarks on Colonel Sofia Qureshi, Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah is under fire again, this time for a viral photo of him with a rape-murder victim's family.

Who is Jasbir Singh, YouTuber arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan?Continuing its crackdown on the Pakistani spy network in India following Operation Sindoor, another YouTuber, Jasbir Singh -- a resident of Punjab's Rupnagar district -- was arrested for his alleged ties with officials from Islamabad, including Ehsan-ur-Rahim alias Danish, who were involved in espionage and the recruitment of Indians.

sports.headline: No open bus parade for RCB due to traffic congestion fearsIPL 2025: The open bus parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru after their Indian Premier League win has been called off due to traffic congestion in the city. On Tuesday, RCB won their maiden title after beating Punjab Kings.

RCB to return to Bengaluru for grand victory parade after historic IPL winRoyal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) are heading back to Bengaluru after their historic IPL victory. A grand celebration awaits the team, including a victory parade starting at 3:30 PM from Akku Vidhan Soda and ending at Chinnaswamy Stadium. The team, led by Virat Kohli, won the title after an 18-year wait. Players will visit the assembly and meet the Chief Minister as part of the celebrations.

Ponting not searching for excuses after PBKS' loss, vows to win IPL next yearPunjab Kings (PBKS) head coach Ricky Ponting refrained from giving any excuses following his team's loss in the final of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). RCB beat PBKS by six runs in the final to claim their maiden IPL title.

Long seen as meme-material in a batting-heavy franchise, the bowlers rose to the occasion when it mattered most—delivering the knockout punch in the final and sealing RCB's maiden title.

Kohli recalls AB de Villiers' eternal legacy: Still has most POTM awards in IPLRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter Virat Kohli recalled AB de Villiers' legacy for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) as the team ended their 18-year-long ICC trophy drought.

French Open Day 11: Djokovic, Sinner, Gauff eye semis berthFrench Open 2025 Day 11 Order of Play: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Coco Gauff, Mirra Andreeva and others will be looking to secure their berths in the semi-finals of the clay-court major.

From Harry Kane to Vijay Mallya: How RCB's title win wowed the worldIPL 2025: Harry Kane, Vijay Mallya and Sachin Tendulkar congratulated Royal Challengers Bengaluru for winning the Indian Premier League title for the first time in 18 seasons.

RCB's trophy breakthrough was built at the auction table: Andy FlowerRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) head coach Andy Flower has revealed how their smart auction strategy helped them to end 18-year long IPL trophy drought. RCB beat PBKS by six runs in the IPL 2025 final to clinch their maiden title.

A season I'll never forget: Virat Kohli shares emotional note after RCB's winIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Virat Kohli had a special message for his fans after the Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the title for the maiden time with a six-run win over Punjab Kings.

Project Punjab isn't a failure, but it needs a few tweaks after IPL 2025 heartbreakPunjab Kings faced heartbreak in the IPL 2025 Final, but 'Project Punjab' is off to a great start. The Kings will have to maintain consistency and they should  make a few tweaks ahead of next year.

RCB beat PBKS by six runs in the IPL 2025 final to clinch their maiden title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
